captions.text: (playful music)
- Which fact would somebody make up?
- Which one do you think is the fake one?

- A. One out of 181 women
will go to the doctor's office

with something other than a
tampon or baby in their vagina.

- That seems believable.
- Yeah.
- A little wacky, 181, very symmetrical.
- I feel like it would be like, 150.

- The world's strongest
vagina can lift 31 pounds.
- How do you lift anything with a vagaina?
(stuttering)
- I think you like, if it was like a ball
that you attach a string to with a weight.
- I think it can lift more than 31 pounds.
- 31 pounds is a lot, even for me to lift.

- And finally C, a doctor
once removed a potato

that started sprouting vines
out of a patient's vagina.
Come on, man.

- That seems believable.
- It wouldn't-- yeah.
- I hope they're all true.

- I think it was like, an old
timey birth control thing?

- C sounds so specific,
that it has to be real.
- Yeah, it just has to be.
It's too-- it's too gross to be fake.
- I can't imagine anybody having a potato
in their vagina for that long.
- [Voiceover] Is that what you guys think?
- I'm gonna say A.

- A is the fake.
- C is the fake.

- I'm gonna go with B.
- Still A.
- [Voiceover] The answer is A.
- God dammit.

- Ah! Ew.
- What?!
- The ancient Aztec civilization
used period blood as war paint.
- That seems rad.
- That seems rad, that seems like a lie.

That seems like there's
a lot of other blood
you could use as war paint.
- I don't know, it's like a weird like,
your woman is on your side
as you're going into battle, right?
- Hormonal changes during your period
can affect the way you poop.

- That sounds like science.
- It sounds like science.
- Everything affects the way you poop.
(laughing)
- I know I saw a BuzzFeed headline

that said something
about periods and poop,

but I didn't read it
'cause I was grossed out.

- In 1946, Disney produced
a short film called
"The Story of Menstruation."

- Well, it was in the '40s,
so they're experimenting,
and it was during the Walt era.
- I actually think I've watched
Disney's "The Story of Menstruation."
- Let's go with C, let's go C.
- C is false.
- Yeah, I think C is fake.

- [Voiceover] Answer's A,
you coulda got it right.
- Woah!
- Yeah, it's A?

- I was afraid of that!
I was so afraid of that.

- According to a 2014 study
of New York City women
aged 20-35, 73% were either ones or twos
on the Kinsey Scale, which translates
to being "a little bit gay."
- I think everybody's a little bit gay.

- So we've gotten tripped
up by numbers before.
- Do you think 73% of women would like,
make out with their roommate in college?

- Yes.
- Yep.

- 73% are a little bit gay,
that sounds about right.
- Girls a bit gay, yeah.

- According to a 2007
Psychology Today study,
strippers make more money while ovulating.
- Hormones. I think hormones,
they're just putting it out there.

Hormones. Fertility.
- Yeah.

- According to a 2012
study, eating an apple a day
can increase sexual pleasure in women.
- I just don't see that happenin'.

Ladies love their fruits,
and they're not about me.
So, I can't think this is a real thing.

- That's silly.
- I dunno.
- Apple.
- I think apples would be most popular.
- A is definitely fake.

- C.
- Apple sex.
- [Voiceover] C is true.
- What?! Aw, man.
- Man, I gotta buy some apples.
- [Voiceover] C is correct.
- Wow.

- Whoo!
- Yeah!
- Woah.
- [Voiceover] The apple thing is true.
- Wow.
- It's too, uh, it's too gross to be fake.
Why would anyone make that up?
What kind of sick mind would make that up?

- Henry?
- Henry, yeah.

title: Guys Guess Women Facts: 2 Facts & A Fake

comments.author: john justin

comments.text:
The apple thing is false. Having a good diet with good health increases the 
ability for sexual response, but all data compiled on the effects of 
"aphrodisiacs" have shown that they are nothing more than placebo effects. 
The only thing shown in scientific studies to actually work is yohimbine 
HCL extract from the root of the yohimbine tree.

These facts are brought to you by my Biology of Human Sexuality class, that 
I am passing with an A, and we did study this.﻿
